srm_reg_array

A register array is a register with number of entries > 1.

An array represents a table in software view.  The design may implement it as register array or memories.  The framework implements sparse array to model the array and so even large external memories can use the same abstraction.

Summary
srm_reg_array
A register array is a register with number of entries > 1.

Initialization

new

function new( string  name,
srm_component  parent,
srm_addr_t  num_entries )

Create a new instance.

parent represents the design component.  num_entries is the size of the array.

Arrays are implemented using sparse associative array and so actual memory used depends on the number of locations accessed.

Introspection

get_num_entries

function int get_num_entries()

Returns the number of entries in the array.

Composite

entry_at

function srm_array_entry#( T ) entry_at(srm_addr_t index)

Returns the entry at the specified index.

index is the position in the array.  Will cause uvm fatal error if the index is more than the size of the array.  FIXME: Explain how entries not yet written are created ?

set_policy

virtual function void set_policy( string  addr_map_name,
srm_base_field_policy  policy )

Sets the policy on all the field nodes of the array.

addr_map_name is the address map.  policy is the policy to be used for the address map.  FIXME: Do all the fields of the entry share the same policies ?

Access Model+Design

load

virtual task load( srm_base_handle  handle )

Load all the entries of the model from the design.

No checking is done and the model is silently updated.  All the entries of the model are created.

store

virtual task store( srm_base_handle  handle )

Store all the entries from the model into the design.

Writes all the array values to the design.  FIXME: explain how non written values are created and written out.

Reset

is_resettable

virtual function bit is_resettable( string  kind )

Returns true if the array is resettable.

All the entries of the table share the same resettable attribute.

reset

virtual function void reset( string  kind )

Reset the array.

Reset the prototype for future entries and delete existing entries.

Debug

get_num_active_entries

virtual function int get_num_active_entries()

Return the number of entries that have been created.

Useful for unit testing the sparse feature.

get_size

virtual function srm_addr_t get_size( string  addr_map_name )

Return the number of bytes in address map.

The size in address map is the width of the entry * num_entries.  FIXME: Why debug api ?

Coverage Interface

attach

virtual function void attach( srm_base_coverage  observer )

Attach an observer to array.

detach

virtual function void detach( srm_base_coverage  observer )

Detach an observer from array, if it exists.

detach_all

virtual function void detach_all()

Detach all observers

get_num_coverage_cbs

virtual function int get_num_coverage_cbs()

Returns the number of coverage callbacks on the node.

For unit testing.
